excerpt: Saint-Paul-de-Vence is a commune in the Alpes-Maritimes department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region of Southeastern France. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Saint-Paul-de-Vence is a charming commune in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region of Southeastern France, offering a perfect day trip away from the French Riviera. This ancient village embodies Provencal stereotypes with its picturesque scenery, old men playing petanque, beautiful views, and art galleries. Nearby towns like Vence and Saint Jeannet add to the allure of the area.
name: St Paul de Vence

excerpt: Hilltop museum & sculpture garden housing works by 20th-century artists like Calder, Miró & Chagall.
detail_description: Located just a short distance from the historic town center of Saint-Paul-de-Vence, Fondation Maeght is a hilltop museum and sculpture garden that showcases an impressive collection of 20th-century artworks by renowned artists such as Calder, Miró, and Chagall.
name: Fondation Maeght

detail_description: Café de la Place is a charming and traditional French brasserie that offers a nostalgic atmosphere, making visitors feel like they've stepped back in time. It's an authentic cafe with a basic menu, offering mainly meat-based options along with some vegetarian choices like paninis and salads. The ambiance is perfect for enjoying a leisurely lunch or just sipping on a drink while soaking in the surroundings.
name: Café de la Place
address: Place du Général de Gaulle, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Fontaine de Saint-Paul-de-Vence is a charming and historic fountain located in the heart of the French village. Dating back to 1615, this Provencal-style fountain adds to the picturesque setting of cobbled lanes and stone dwellings. The fountain, redesigned in the 19th century, features a sculpture with four spouts pouring water into its central basin. Visitors can easily locate it at place de la Grande-Fontaine, making it a central point for exploring the town.
name: Fontaine de Saint-Paul-de-Vence

detail_description: Saint Paul de Vence Cemetery is a significant attraction in the charming town of Saint-Paul-de-Vence, located in the south of France, Provence. The cemetery is the final resting place of renowned artists and figures such as Marc Chagall, who resided in the French Riviera from the late 1940s until his passing.
name: Saint Paul de Vence Cemetery

detail_description: Rue Grande is a charming and bustling street located in the heart of a vibrant city. It is lined with an eclectic mix of shops, cafes, and restaurants, offering a wide variety of local and international goods and cuisine. The street is known for its lively atmosphere and is a popular destination for both locals and tourists alike. Visitors can stroll along the cobblestone pavement, taking in the sights and sounds of this dynamic area.
name: Rue Grande

excerpt: Creative, globally-inflected Mediterranean food & Provençal wines on a leafy patio with hill views.
detail_description: Restaurant Le Tilleul is a charming spot located just behind the ramparts of the picturesque village of Saint-Paul-de-Vence. The place offers a leafy patio under a majestic tree, which quickly fills up during summer. Chef Olivier Renaud presents a refined Mediterranean cuisine with global influences, using local ingredients and Provençal wines. The restaurant also features a tea room menu and delicacies to be enjoyed on its sunny terrace with panoramic views.
name: Restaurant Le Tilleul

excerpt: Hillside restaurant & bar with a snug dining room & casual plates, plus a terrace & scenic views.
detail_description: Les Remparts is a hillside restaurant and bar offering a snug dining room, casual plates, and a terrace with scenic views. The restaurant provides a romantic setting with 180-degree views across the valley. It has an outdoor patio and cozy indoor space with Mediterranean medieval vibes. The menu offers delicious options made from high-quality ingredients, such as burrata and fregola salad, ceviche, and fish of the day.
name: Les Remparts
address: Rem Sud-Ouest Courtine Sainte-Anne, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: The Chapelle des Pénitents Blancs, also known as Folon Chapel, is a 17th-century church in Saint-Paul-de-Vence near Nice. The interior is adorned with the artwork of Belgian artist Jean-Michel Folon, including vibrant mosaics, sculptures, and paintings. The chapel's stained glass windows were created in collaboration with artisans. Visitors are recommended to visit this unassuming yet luminescent church to see the striking Folon mural.
name: Chapelle des Pénitents Blancs
Maison de Jacques Prevert
address: 4 Rue de la Cassette, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: La Table de Pierre is a renowned gastronomic restaurant located within the Domaine du Mas de Pierre in Saint-Paul-de-Vence. The restaurant, which underwent a complete renovation in 2021, is known for offering a culinary journey through Provençal flavors using locally sourced ingredients such as vegetables from the hotel's garden, olive oil from Nice, cheeses from Var, and chocolates from Grasse.
name: La Table de Pierre

excerpt: Vence is a commune set in the hills of the Alpes-Maritimes department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in Southeastern France, north of Nice and Antibes on the Mediterranean coast. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Vence, a charming commune located in the hills of the Alpes-Maritimes department in Southeastern France, is nestled north of Nice and Antibes along the Mediterranean coast. This medieval town has been a magnet for artists due to its picturesque setting amidst hills adorned with olive and orange trees, offering breathtaking views of both the sea and mountains. Vence's old village, mild climate, and vibrant colors are particularly beloved by visitors.
name: Vence

detail_description: Collégiale Saint Paul is a small church with a rich history, dating back to the 14th century and later renovated in the 18th century. The church exudes an ancient charm and provides a serene atmosphere for visitors to pause and reflect. Situated in the picturesque village of St. Paul de Vence, it is surrounded by quaint streets and artisan shops, creating an authentic and cozy ambiance.
name: Collégiale Saint Paul
address: Bell Tower, 5 Rue Bastion St Rémy, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: The Ramparts of Saint Paul de Vence, completed in 1547, are a significant part of the town's history and offer stunning views over the surrounding villages. Strolling through this medieval village allows for picturesque scenes of small archways, stepped roads, and trailing wisteria plants. The town is known for its ateliers featuring art from local artists, though some pieces can be pricey. Despite the expensive restaurants, visitors find that the breathtaking views make it all worthwhile.
name: Ramparts of Saint Paul de Vence
Le Caruso
address: 1 Mnt de la Castre, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Marc Chagall’s Grave is located in the cemetery of Saint Paul de Vence, a village that was home to the renowned artist. The cemetery also holds the graves of other notable figures like former Rolling Stones bass player Bill Wyman. The village itself is steeped in artistic history, with influences from artists like Paul Signac and Pablo Picasso evident in its numerous art studios.
name: Marc Chagall’s Grave

detail_description: Hostellerie de la Fontaine, a charming hotel located in the heart of Saint-Paul-de-Vence, is an ideal choice for those seeking accommodation in the medieval village. Situated above the renowned Place de la Grande Fontaine and conveniently close to other popular attractions, this establishment offers a prime location. Moreover, it boasts one of the finest dining options in Saint-Paul-de-Vence, alleviating any concerns about where to enjoy a satisfying dinner.
name: Hostellerie La Fontaine - hotel-restaurant Saint Paul de vence
address: 11 Dsc de la Castre, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Tour de l'Espéron is a must-see in the beautiful historic village not far from Cannes and Nice. It's a square tower that was part of the medieval town walls and was once used as a gunpowder store. The surrounding area offers lovely walking paths, small streets, art galleries, and breathtaking views of the Mediterranean Sea and mountains. This romantic old city on top of a hill is definitely worth a visit for anyone exploring Nice or the French Riviera.
name: Tour de l'Espéron
address: 5 Rue de la Pourtoune, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: La Maison Godet Parfum, a health and beauty shop located in St. Paul de Vence, is a charming establishment that offers a unique experience for perfume enthusiasts. Run by the talented Sonia Godet, this family-owned business resurrects traditional perfume-making practices to create exquisite fragrances. The beautiful store exudes an enchanting atmosphere and is filled with locally produced perfumes made from cruelty-free raw materials.
name: La Maison Godet Parfum
Parking BUS Saint Paul de Vence
Chapelle Saint Michel
address: Cimetière, 66 Rte de Nice, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

excerpt: Tourrettes-sur-Loup is a commune in the Alpes-Maritimes department in southeastern France. It has been called Tourrettes-sur-Loup ever since the early twentieth century although prior to that it was known as Tourrettes-les-Vence, a name that arose in the sixteenth century and lasted until the French revolution. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Tourrettes-sur-Loup, a commune in southeastern France, was previously known as Tourrettes-les-Vence before the early twentieth century. The town is renowned for its cultivation of violets and is often referred to as the 'City of Violets.' Its medieval center is filled with craft shops and sits atop a rocky spur overlooking a steep gorge. The village enjoys an ideal climate throughout the year and offers stunning views of rolling hills.
name: Tourrettes-sur-Loup

detail_description: Baou de Saint-Jeannet is a popular mountain in the Grasse foothills, attracting hikers and climbers with its stunning views of Saint-Paul-de-Vence. The hike to the summit takes around 2.30 hours and starts from the village entrance, leading through Rue de la Croix and Rue du Baou. The trail is well-marked but challenging at times due to loose stones.
name: baou de Saint-Jeannet
Bogena Galerie
address: 777 Rte de la Colle, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Au Jardin de la Vague is a charming restaurant just outside Saint Paul de Vence, offering clean and contemporary interiors as well as a lovely terrace with panoramic views. The menu features local cuisine with an emphasis on quality, fresh, seasonal, and homemade dishes. Guests praise the impeccable service despite unexpected rain. The chef's selection menu is highly recommended for those looking to indulge in a sensational dining experience.
name: Au Jardin de la Vague
address: Hôtel La Vague de, Chem. des Salettes, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Restaurant Sol is a superb establishment that comes highly recommended. The selection of dishes on offer is excellent, and the quality of the meal itself is truly exceptional. I have dined at this restaurant three times, and each visit has consistently met my expectations. One particularly noteworthy aspect is that there are always new additions to the menu, which is exactly what you would expect from such an establishment. Additionally, the service provided by the staff is friendly yet professional, ensuring a spotless experience.
name: Restaurant à St Paul de Vence | Cuisine Maison & Événements Privés - SOL
address: Accès par les jardins, 343 Chemin des Gardettes, 5766 Chem. des Trious, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: La Brouette is a charming restaurant nestled on a hillside with breathtaking views of Saint-Paul-de-Vence. Run by a Danish couple, this rustic eatery offers a warm and romantic atmosphere with its lovingly decorated interior and terraced gardens. As one of the oldest restaurants in the area, it exudes historical charm. The menu is concise but features high-quality and delicious options, making it an ideal spot for a memorable dining experience.
name: La Brouette

detail_description: FONDATION CAB in St-Paul-de-Vence is a must-visit for art and design enthusiasts. It also serves as a guesthouse, offering 4 rooms and a Jean Prouve house for rent. Everywhere you look, there's beauty - from Perriand or Prouve furniture to Mediterranean gardens, and even a view of Cap d'Antibes on the horizon.
name: FONDATION CAB St-Paul-de-Vence

detail_description: When you find yourself in the enchanting region of Saint-Paul-de-Vence, make sure to take a leisurely drive along the picturesque Route des Serres. This charming road not only connects Saint-Paul-de-Vence with nearby towns like La Colle-sur-Loup and Vence but also offers breathtaking views that will leave you in awe. As you navigate through this scenic route, you'll be surrounded by lush olive groves and vibrant Mediterranean flora, creating a stunning backdrop against the rolling hills and valleys.
name: Route des Serres

detail_description: Porte de Vence, also known as the Gate of Vence, is a lively area with Rue Grande being the main street leading from Porte de Nice to Porte de Vence. The old stone walls are adorned with clematis and artists can be seen painting in their unique styles. One must not miss Fontaine de Saint-Paul-de-Vence, an old marketplace and fountain where locals traditionally gather for water and washing.
name: Porte de Vence / Gate of Vence
address: Rue de la Tour, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Mister Check is a cozy and unassuming restaurant located in Saint-Paul de Vence, offering a simple yet delightful dining experience. The establishment features a small number of indoor and outdoor tables, making it an ideal spot for a casual lunch or snack. The menu boasts an extensive selection of authentic Thai cuisine, with one of the chefs hailing from Thailand and renowned for crafting exceptional Pad Thai.
name: Mister Check
address: 5 Pl. de la Mairie, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Pl. Charles de Gaulle, also called Pl. du Jeu de Boules, is a lively spot at the village entrance where locals gather to play boules. The competitive games are entertaining to watch, and visitors can relax at Cafe de la Place with a refreshing drink while observing the action.
name: Pl. Charles de Gaulle

detail_description: Remy Bastion offers a captivating journey through history, where visitors can start their exploration at either Point du Vue near Porte de Nice or from the staircase by Point de Vue, Bastion St-Re. As you stroll along the ramparts, you're treated to breathtaking vistas that encompass both the charming old city and the picturesque countryside of Provence.
name: Remy Bastion
address: Rem Sud-Ouest Courtine Sainte-Anne, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: If you're planning a visit to the enchanting village of Saint-Paul de Vence, make sure to stop by the Office de Tourisme. This charming spot is your gateway to exploring the rich history and stunning architecture that defines this bastion, originally commissioned by François I. You can stroll along a newly developed path at the base of the western ramparts, where you'll gain insights into both historical contexts and agricultural traditions that continue to thrive in this picturesque locale.
name: Office de Tourisme

detail_description: The Local History Museum of St-Paul de Vence is a must-visit attraction, housed in an ancient village building. It features wax figures of historical figures like King Francois and Queen Jeanne, along with captivating dioramas showcasing period costumes that kids will enjoy. The museum ticket also grants access to the stunning Chapel of Polon, known for its beauty and unique background music designed specifically for the chapel.
name: Local History Museum
address: Mnt de la Castre, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: The Eglise Saint Paul, a Catholic church with a contemporary interior design, is an exquisite historical site that offers a stunning panorama. The church combines modern elements within its premises and showcases its age-old beauty. The view from the church is truly breathtaking, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the splendor of this ancient place of worship.
name: Eglise Saint Paul

detail_description: CHOISY LA GALERIE is a captivating discovery, a unique fusion of artistic expertise and creative talent. This Gallery-Boutique showcases the beautiful collaboration between a painter father and his imaginative daughter who transforms her dad's sketches into exquisite ready-to-wear fashion pieces. The window display immediately caught my eye, particularly an enchanting dress that I simply couldn't resist. I left with not just one but two dresses that had captivated me in their photographic form.
name: CHOISY LA GALERIE

detail_description: Nestled within the charming streets of the town, Galerie Cachée stands out among numerous art galleries with its captivating window displays. These artistic showcases harmoniously blend with the medieval architecture surrounding them, creating a picturesque scene that is perfect for those looking to capture a quick yet breathtaking photograph. Whether you're an art enthusiast or simply strolling through, Galerie Cachée offers a delightful visual experience that reflects both creativity and history.
name: Galerie Cachée
address: 6 Rue de la Pourtoune, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

name: Atelier Om
address: 6 Rue de la Pourtoune, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: The Circle of Artists of St. Paul de Vence is a charming and ideally located venue with a vaulted room featuring typical exposed stones. Visitors can enjoy a lovely view from the space in front of the entrance, and it's recommended to park at the bottom of the village and continue on foot. The village itself offers magnificent sights, wonderful visits, delicious ice cream, and great shopping opportunities for a leisurely and relaxing experience.
name: Circle of Artists of St. Paul de Vence
address: 2 Rue de la Pourtoune, 06570 Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France

detail_description: Galerie Hesbe Bolzonello is a charming art space that immerses visitors in the captivating world of impressionism. The gallery showcases original oil paintings created with a pallet-knife technique, offering a glimpse into the soul of St Paul de Vence. The artworks depict scenes of old stones, flowered streets, bougainvillea-adorned facades, and serene seaside vistas. Visitors can also admire landscapes of Provence in the style of impressionism.
name: Galerie Hesbe Bolzonello
